par.text: Nickel is a silvery-white, hard and malleable metal. It exhibits ferromagnetic properties - it becomes highly magnetised in a magnetic field. For nickel the Curie point (the temperature at which an element loses its ferromagnetic properties) is found to be 357

C. Nickel is a good conductor of heat and electricity, but its chemical reactivity is rather low. Nickel does not corrode in air. When heated, it reacts with phosphorus, arsenic, oxygen and the halogens. Nickel dissolves in acids, displacing hydrogen. The element and its compounds are toxic.
